Graph utilities¶

Base Class¶

class CanteraPFR.ct_graph.BaseGraph¶

Bases: networkx.classes.graph.Graph

Base class for chemical graphs.

This class should be initialized in derived classes by calling method _base_init after inheritance initilization. Its interface is described here instead of the __init__ one.

Parameters:
  • sol (cantera.Solution) – Solution object representing the kinetics mechanism.
  • fullfmt (bool) – If True, print all edges in mechanism
adjacency_matrix¶

Returns the adjacency matrix.

Returns:The adjacency matrix of interacting nodes.
Return type:numpy.array
degree_histogram¶

Return of nodes degrees.

Returns:List indexed by degree with the number of its occurences.
Return type:list
density¶

Graph density.

ordered_degree¶

Returns of nodes ordered by degree.

Returns:List of pairs <node, degree>, ordered by degree.
Return type:list
plot_adjmatrix¶

Interface to CanteraPFR.ct_aux.plot_adjmatrix().

plot_deghist¶

Interface to CanteraPFR.ct_aux.plot_deghist().

solution¶

Access to graph’s cantera.Solution object.

Directed Graph¶

class CanteraPFR.ct_graph.DirectedGraph¶

Bases: networkx.classes.digraph.DiGraph, CanteraPFR.ct_graph.BaseGraph

Generate species directed relational graph.

An edge is added for every pair of interacting species in a reaction. If \(A\rightarrow{}B\), then a directed edge is added between these.

Note

No self loops \((A\rightarrow{}A)\) are generated in the graph.

Parameters:
  • sol (cantera.Solution) – Solution object representing the kinetics mechanism.
  • fullfmt (bool, optional) – If True, print all edges in mechanism. Default is False.
complexes¶

Return complexes for building Feinberg–Horn–Jackson graph.

divide_edges¶

Divide edges by function.

Parameters:func (function) – Function used to increment edges val property. This function takes the names of nodes A and B as arguments.
ordered_in_degree¶

Returns list of tuples (node, degree) ordered by degree.

Returns:List of tuples of species and respective degree.
Return type:list
ordered_out_degree¶

Returns list of tuples (node, degree) ordered by degree.

Returns:List of tuples of species and respective degree.
Return type:list
reinitialize_graph¶

Set the value of property val of all edges to zero.

sort_edges¶

Sort graph edges by key using a function.

Parameters:
  • func (function) – Function to provide ordering.
  • reverse (bool, optional) – If True, returns in reverse order.
Returns:

List of edges ordered accoding to func.
Return type:

list
update_edges¶

Update edges values.

Parameters:
  • src (list) – List of source nodes names.
  • dst (list) – List of destination nodes names.
  • func (function) – Function used to increment edges val property. This function takes the names of nodes A and B as arguments.

Undirected Graph¶

class CanteraPFR.ct_graph.UndirectedGraph¶

Bases: CanteraPFR.ct_graph.BaseGraph

Generate species undirected relational graph.

An edge is added for every pair of species in a reaction.

Note

No self loops \((A\rightarrow{}A)\) are generated in the graph.

Parameters:
  • sol (cantera.Solution) – Solution object representing the kinetics mechanism.
  • fullfmt (bool, optional) – If True, print all edges in mechanism. Default is False.

Analysis tools¶

CanteraPFR.ct_graph.analyse_graph()¶

Automatic analysis of species graph.

This method provides a preliminary mechanism species graph analysis. It is able to filter species and reactions from a species file and perform analysis of simpler versions of a mechanism. An input file and graph type are required inputs. Optional arguments are the base name to save the resulting files and the list of species to filter the mechanism. Graph species connection degree output is supplied as well as a basic report with the number of nodes, edges and density. Plots adjacency matrix graph histogram.

Todo

Document keyword arguments.

Parameters:
  • mech (str) – Mechanism file path in Cantera’s format.
  • graph_class (BaseGraph) – Graph class to be used.
Returns:

Return generated graph with derived type graph_class.
Return type:

BaseGraph
